headline: Biden races to allocate CHIPS Act funding to chipmakers: BBG
summary: President Biden signed the CHIPS and Science Act into law in 2022, which provided roughly $39 billion in federal grants to boost semiconductor manufacturing within the United States. However, only a small fraction of the allocated funding has actually been distributed to chip companies so far. With just over two months remaining before President-elect Donald Trump reassumes office, Biden is now racing to finalize these CHIPS Act contracts before the transition of power, according to a Bloomberg report. Yahoo Finance special reporter Akiko Fujita breaks down the details, discussing the feasibility of Biden completing these deals within the limited time frame. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith
